posts.title: Regeneron to buy bankrupt DNA testing firm 23andMe for $256 million
top_comments:
Delete Your Data From 23andMe

https://www.nytimes.com/wirecutter/reviews/wirecutter-show-podcast-20250328-23andme-data-bankrupt/

$256 million/15 million customers = $17.

Your DNA is worth $17.
Can't wait to fight my genetically upgraded evil clone, designed to replace me!!

IMO the biggest miss with 23&Me is them not buying Ancestry.com, etc, to help build a collaborative genealogical chart system families could use and edit, or expanding on it with local family related news and documents available throughout the generations to better piece together familial history and even photos, etc.

Aside from selling biological info to ad companies or insurers or other seedy profiteers, I don’t see why they couldn’t have made money from a reduced priced option for current members / entrants to access the “plus” member benefits or used the genetic data and self reports, combined with localized double blind studies ofc, to confirm data trends that could be profitable while also not selling discreet information.

I feel like they just didn’t broaden the definition of what was possible under their company’s umbrella.
I never did a DNA test because I always felt it was going to be used for transactional reasons. This is exactly why; Your information is whoever buys it.

I sent my DNA in knowing all the pitfalls (to Ancestry, not 23andMe, but same thing) because I'm adopted and wanted to find my biological family. I actually found them, and now have a solid relationship with my full biological brother, which has been well worth any horrors that might occur from my DNA being in a database. Otherwise, I wouldn't do this.

I am a former Regeneron employee (retired).  I can say they are not buying the failing business. They are buying the genetic database to use in the development of new monoclonal antibody therapeutic proteins.  There is an arms race to get to good candidates first to stake out patents to prevent competitors access to whole categories of potential therapies. They have lost several lawsuits to others who got there first metaphorically speaking.  They have technology to rapidly test candidates with Velocogene and could theoretically get dozens of billion dollar drugs from this dataset without any patent fights. The money spent is peanuts to its potential value.  While I am not a huge fan of the cost of these therapies , I personally know the tens to hundreds of thousands of man hours that go into developing these drugs, and they can be astonishingly effective.  It’s not popular to say you worked in big pharma but I’m very proud of the work I did there and how it has affected patients, including members of my own extended family.

Ok, I guess I need to brace for the downvotes given the current comments here. 

Honestly, this is worlds better than an insurance company or some random tech startup with undescribed end goals, guys. This is a legitimate big pharmaceutical company who has a lot of R&D around genetic disease and has made a lot of therapeutic advances. They want the data to develop new therapies, probably ones for genetic based disease. Being the first to do this will make them so much money. That’s their goal here, I think. It’s new massively growing space in R&D. And this much genetic data is research treasure trove for them.

They are also going to have pre-designed protocols and standards when it comes to handling this data. I know people side eye big pharma (rightfully in most circumstances) but this is a much better outcome than many other situations.

Am I saying don’t delete your data? No. Am I saying this is better than pretty much any other potential buyer? Absolutely.

I also want to add one thing: All the stuff about Trump ties is wild. Pretty much every pharma company (and  many of the academic researchers that Trump is now black listing from NIH funding due to their coronavirus research) got Project Warp Speed funding during the pandemic. Monoclonal antibody treatment was an absolute scientific miracle. So were the other rapid vaccine developments during the pandemic. It saved so many lives.

Ah, good thing it didn’t get sold to an unscrupulous buyer that engages in securities fraud, price fixing, and has ties to the current administration. 

Oh wait.  

If you haven’t deleted your data from 23andMe, do it now.
What are the downsides of them having our dna data. I keep seeing everyone saying delete it.

posts.title: CBS News chief steps down amid tension over Trump lawsuit
top_comments: Another example as to why independent media is important

I'm not even sure what the main problem is with mainstream news organizations are, cowardice, greed, avarice, or stupidity.

At this point I'm convinced we as a society are better off without giant corporations controlling all aspects of news and entertainment. 

Break them all up.

Super fun to watch all the news orgs capitulate to the fascist fuck. I'm sure this bodes well for our future. 4 months in and you can see just how primed the wealthy are to abandon entire groups of people and democracy itself to ensure they keep making money.
Last night on Last Week Tonight.
People in the US are so weak
Another brick in the wall against fascism has crumbled.
There goes the reporting, what’s left? A scattered, frayed court system. Coming Soon Amerirussa 🤷‍♂️
It's all about the Benjamins. News left the room when it was placed under "entertainment" management years ago. Rich people are trying to make more money while pissing on the proletariat.

It’s wild that 60 minutes probably won’t make it through this psychotic merger because of greed and the administration. If I were Comcast or Disney, I’d be looking to snag as many of the workers as possible, and start their own news magazine show. I’d start strategizing a show to run on Sunday at 7 to start picking them off. Disney, in particular, has been leading the other two in the nightly news slot for a while with World News Tonight. It’s a golden opportunity to lock CBS out of news ratings forever. It’s amazing that the Tiffany network, with its prestigious history of news by the way of Murrow, Cronkite, and Couric, has let their news department become second rate at best. You can even see, Face the Nation is second tier compared to Meet the Press and This Week. It’s a weaker program than CNNs Sunday Show, and is now more parred up with Fox’s Sunday show. 60 minutes and Sunday Morning, were kinda the two last news shows that carried any prestige within the network. It’s so far from being the Tiffany network they used to be lauded as.

posts.title: Supreme Court allows Trump administration to strip legal protections from 350,000 Venezuelans, potentially exposing them to deportation.
top_comments: Only one noted dissent is very interesting.

Sad but expected. TPS designation is pretty explicitly under the domain of the executive branch. And this is just letting the former designation expire, simply refusing to extend it. Rather than trying to end the designation prematurely.

*Exile* not deportation.

These people will not go to Venezuela, they'll be [trafficked to El Salvador, Libya, Rwanda](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/14/world/trump-administration-deportees.html)

This is not deportation. This is human trafficking. They will be sold into slavery. Deportation means they get due process and are sent freely back to their country of origin. These are crimes against humanity. The rest of the world should be sanctioning us.

So we're being invaded by gangs from Venezuela, enough so that Trump needed to enact the alien enemies act, but also, Venezuela isn't too dangerous anymore and it's safe to send Venezuelan refugees back to Venezuela? The supreme court doesn't ask questions like this?
They claimed that there were millions of illegals here but they revoke protections and citizenship of hundreds of thousands of people instead.
Hateful, racist administration that's doing *exactly* what they said they wanted to do.
Have to agree with the SCOTUS, Biden had the authority to our the additional protections, and Trump has the authority to take them off.
Hey for those Venezuelan Trumpers  who had TPS family members, I’m gonna play “Yo Voto por Donal Tron” while they get sent home!!!

posts.title: Shipment of thousands of chicks left in USPS truck. Overwhelmed shelter needs help adopting them
top_comments:
This is brutal.

>A Delaware animal shelter is trying to care for and rehome thousands of chicks that survived being left in a postal service truck for three days. **Trapped in a warm enclosure, without food and water, thousands died before they were discovered on May 2**, [CBS affiliate WBOC](https://www.wboc.com/news/delaware-shelter-caring-for-thousands-of-birds-after-shipping-mishap/article_002f58bc-db85-4203-99af-0a2a363308cf.html) reported.
Horrible timeline for eyes, ears, and a heart
We have 8 chicks in the hands of USPS as we speak. We will be first time chicken parents. This isn’t exactly encouraging.

>Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

I've got just under a hundred assorted breeds that are free to come and go as they please. I keep them solely for the eggs, the company (plus they make good sentries for my other critters re predators etc) and because they eat bugs. But almost all my chickens eventually die of old age. 

Just sayin, chickens are pretty awesome.
Humans really suck, huh
Oh geez, one of my good friends has a farm in the area — texting her to see if they can take some of them in.

How horrifying. Those poor chicks. 

This won’t help the price of eggs, I’d imagine.
On LaJoy's watch? Color me shocked...

> Some have inquired about buying the birds for meat, but, as a no-kill shelter and SPCA, those were refused.

This seems like a pointless line drawn in the sand.
Some guys just seem to have no trouble getting the chicks.

posts.title: Judge strikes down DOGE takeover of the U.S. Institute of Peace
top_comments:
>The United States Institute of Peace has existed for 40 years on a $50 million annual budget, *but failed to deliver peace*. President Trump is right to reduce failed, useless entities like USIP to their statutory minimum.

Umm... I'm pretty sure that's not how peace works.

If delivery of peace was ever a possibility on a $50M annual budget the world would be a much better place. Not being 100% successful in an impossible mission doesn't mean their work didn't contribute to peace, or that it wasn't worth the cost.

> After members of the DOGE team took over the building with the help of law enforcement. most institute employees were subsequently laid off.

Can we really call them "law enforcement" at this point?  
What they were doing wasn't legal.
This isn't going to bring back USIP; what's done is done. The staff have all been fired and the programs shuttered.

As Orange Marmalade has said repeatedly, there are armed, face-masked gangs of criminals roaming our streets, and the present administration is doing nothing about them.  Not sure if THEY are eating the pets, the cats, and the dogs, but I would not put it past them at this point.

Stay Safe Americans.  Reducing your suntan(s) for the next few years is probably the smart move here.
Screw peace, fascism is funner and more profitable. /s

Our Congress has been under Republican majorities for most of the time the past 40 years, and they have failed to produce anything resembling a balance budget. The only periods where it was at or near being balanced was during Democratic majorities. Can we throw the Republicans out, please?
Not gonna lie, I didn’t know there was a US Institute of Peace.
So..... when do we start calling these 'law enforcement agents' the Covfefe or Orange Police?
"You can't steal buildings."

posts.title: ‘A family is torn apart’: Three children in family killed after vehicle struck by allegedly impaired driver
top_comments:
Absolute nightmare; what do you even do after something like this? Grieve? That word feels totally worthless to describe what this family's going through. You grieve for your grandmother, your beloved family pet, your troubled uncle who overdosed. What do you do when it feels like Hell itself has opened up before you, and swallowed up everything you loved?

I don't have an answer, but I hope they find peace - and, if they're a far better person than I, forgiveness.
That asshole should serve 3 consecutive life sentences!

To think this selfish person only had to use an app probably already set up on their phone. 

In situations like this if they can trace the drunk back to a bar, that bar should also be in trouble. 

Bartenders, please cut people off if they are driving.

Edit

I have been made aware that the drunk is only 19 so probably not at a bar. The headline was upsetting enough and I didn't read the article out of self preservation of my mental health. 

This situation just sucks.

It's crazy how many families are ripped apart like this. Four of the five fatalities while I was in school were from cars. 

I still find it crazy how dangerous driving is compared to how everyday it is. It's by far the biggest cause of death for young people (38% for car accidents, 13% for the next one, homicide) https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/products/databriefs/db37.htm#sum

posts.title: Judge strikes down DOGE takeover of the U.S. Institute of Peace
top_comments:
>The United States Institute of Peace has existed for 40 years on a $50 million annual budget, *but failed to deliver peace*. President Trump is right to reduce failed, useless entities like USIP to their statutory minimum.

Umm... I'm pretty sure that's not how peace works.

If delivery of peace was ever a possibility on a $50M annual budget the world would be a much better place. Not being 100% successful in an impossible mission doesn't mean their work didn't contribute to peace, or that it wasn't worth the cost.

> After members of the DOGE team took over the building with the help of law enforcement. most institute employees were subsequently laid off.

Can we really call them "law enforcement" at this point?  
What they were doing wasn't legal.
This isn't going to bring back USIP; what's done is done. The staff have all been fired and the programs shuttered.

As Orange Marmalade has said repeatedly, there are armed, face-masked gangs of criminals roaming our streets, and the present administration is doing nothing about them.  Not sure if THEY are eating the pets, the cats, and the dogs, but I would not put it past them at this point.

Stay Safe Americans.  Reducing your suntan(s) for the next few years is probably the smart move here.
Screw peace, fascism is funner and more profitable. /s

Our Congress has been under Republican majorities for most of the time the past 40 years, and they have failed to produce anything resembling a balance budget. The only periods where it was at or near being balanced was during Democratic majorities. Can we throw the Republicans out, please?
Not gonna lie, I didn’t know there was a US Institute of Peace.

posts.title: Supreme Court allows Trump administration to strip legal protections from 350,000 Venezuelans, potentially exposing them to deportation.
top_comments: Only one noted dissent is very interesting.

Sad but expected. TPS designation is pretty explicitly under the domain of the executive branch. And this is just letting the former designation expire, simply refusing to extend it. Rather than trying to end the designation prematurely.

*Exile* not deportation.

These people will not go to Venezuela, they'll be [trafficked to El Salvador, Libya, Rwanda](https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/14/world/trump-administration-deportees.html)

This is not deportation. This is human trafficking. They will be sold into slavery. Deportation means they get due process and are sent freely back to their country of origin. These are crimes against humanity. The rest of the world should be sanctioning us.

posts.title: CBS News chief steps down amid tension over Trump lawsuit
top_comments: Another example as to why independent media is important

I'm not even sure what the main problem is with mainstream news organizations are, cowardice, greed, avarice, or stupidity.

At this point I'm convinced we as a society are better off without giant corporations controlling all aspects of news and entertainment. 

Break them all up.

Super fun to watch all the news orgs capitulate to the fascist fuck. I'm sure this bodes well for our future. 4 months in and you can see just how primed the wealthy are to abandon entire groups of people and democracy itself to ensure they keep making money.
Last night on Last Week Tonight.
People in the US are so weak
Another brick in the wall against fascism has crumbled.
There goes the reporting, what’s left? A scattered, frayed court system. Coming Soon Amerirussa 🤷‍♂️
It's all about the Benjamins. News left the room when it was placed under "entertainment" management years ago. Rich people are trying to make more money while pissing on the proletariat.

It’s wild that 60 minutes probably won’t make it through this psychotic merger because of greed and the administration. If I were Comcast or Disney, I’d be looking to snag as many of the workers as possible, and start their own news magazine show. I’d start strategizing a show to run on Sunday at 7 to start picking them off. Disney, in particular, has been leading the other two in the nightly news slot for a while with World News Tonight. It’s a golden opportunity to lock CBS out of news ratings forever. It’s amazing that the Tiffany network, with its prestigious history of news by the way of Murrow, Cronkite, and Couric, has let their news department become second rate at best. You can even see, Face the Nation is second tier compared to Meet the Press and This Week. It’s a weaker program than CNNs Sunday Show, and is now more parred up with Fox’s Sunday show. 60 minutes and Sunday Morning, were kinda the two last news shows that carried any prestige within the network. It’s so far from being the Tiffany network they used to be lauded as.

posts.title: Spain orders Airbnb to block nearly 66,000 holiday rental listings over rule violations
top_comments:
I've been a fan of AIRBnB for a long time, and I like the idea of people being able to rent out a home, their own or another, for a short period of time...

But it's gotten too commercialized.

Sites like these should only be allowing individuals, not businesses, who normally reside in those countries to rent out their primary, or perhaps a secondary residence for short term rentals.

People shouldnt have 3+ properties they are renting out short term.  You want to have 3+ properties, long term rentals only for anything above your primary +1.

I still use AIRBnB, but hotel pricing has come a long way in the past few years, where now it's a toss up if I look at Airbnb or hotels when I'm on vacation.  So it isn't even the savings it used to be which drove me to it in the first place.
I was such a big fan of Airbnb, I did everything with it, vacations, just a night out in another city, everything. Then it turned to shit. Now I don't want anything to do with it.

Good.

Tourism is a big part of the Spanish economy but it has l been kidnapped by capitalist profiteers who will do everything to earn an extra penny.

They are squeezing out the liveability of the big city's and making live miserable for both the citizens as wel as the tourists.

It's not enough. To solve the housing crisis you need to ban corporations from buying, owning and renting homes, as well as institute a cap on property ownership (imo no more than 2 properties per person), and heavily tax short term rentals. Just going after AirBnB is like putting a bandaid on an exposed bone
We should've done the same here in Portugal. Unfortunately, we are now paying the price of inaction - socialy, financialy, and politicaly.
Hate airBNBs The ruin quiet neighborhoods and are mostly corporate owned
Good. AirBnB can rot in hell. Lived next to a full-time one for years. During Covid. Had to move. That company and all similar ones can screw off.

I still dont get why Airbnb hosts charge you a cleaning fee then ask you to run the dishwasher, laundry, take the trash out etc. Haven't used Airbnb for a few years now because of this. You can't charge me a cleaning fee and make me do chores. Its one or the other

Before I moved to Spain, I got an Airbnb in the center. Rented it from a lady who was on vacation. 

Fast forward to moving there, and she’s the last person living in the building full-time. This is maybe 20-30 units. 

She eventually moves. Now the entire building is Airbnb, and they even have a front desk. Sooooo much of that has been going on for a while where I live. It’s gross.
love this! I am here for the demise of vacation rentals.
